title: Why most American Jews will and should vote for Kamala Harris
message:
Two separate issues are front and centre for American Jews in the run-up to Election Day on November 5.
I support Kamala Harris enthusiastically in large part because there are, in fact, two Americas.
and George W. Bush, And yes, it is the America of Kamala Harris.
Which brings us to why American Jews roughly 75 percent of American Jews did not want anything to do with Trump the last two go rounds and are almost certain to remain true to form this year.
Yet another reason: Almost as many American Jews support continued aid to Ukraine (77 percent) as support aid to Israel (80 percent).

message:
President Isaac Herzog announced on Wednesday the launch of a pivotal global survey to shape dialogue and leadership development within the Jewish world — the first step as part of his Voice of the People initiative.
The survey will help in the creation of a new worldwide Jewish advisory council set to address the most pressing challenges facing Jewish communities in Israel and the Diaspora.
The survey we are launching today will shape the council, and therefore shape the discussions impacting the future of the Jewish people.
I encourage everyone to participate and contribute to help build our collective future,” President Isaac Herzog said.
These groups will be supported by senior "mentors" from the Jewish world who will assist them in realizing their vision.
event_breakdown: Antisemitic car vandalizations and property destruction were reported in various parts of the Portland metropolitan area in Oregon on Tuesday. In a Twitter post, Chabad announced that anti-Semitic graffiti was discovered on the wall of a Chabad center in Sandy Springs, Georgia. Local police were notified of the incident.
